game

Class Position

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Position

  • public class Position
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing a location on the soccer field, with x and y coordinates (integer numbers).
    When an element (barrier/goal) is in a Position it covers the square from (x,y) to (x+1,y+1), that is, all real (double) numbers in between.

      • toDoublePosition

        public DoublePosition toDoublePosition()
        Returns:
        obtains a transformation to an object of type DoublePosition where the coordinates realX and realY are the corresponding double values of x and y.
        For example, if x=1 and y=3 it will create an object DoublePosition with DoublePosition.realX = 1.0 and DoublePosition.realY = 3.0.
